Pharmaceutical Cost-Effectiveness Test Data

Source: R/data-documentation.R
pharma_decision_data.Rd

A comprehensive dataset for pharmaceutical decision tree analysis, including drug comparisons, dosing strategies, and health economic outcomes.

Usage

pharma_decision_data

Format

A data frame with 150 rows and 20 variables:

study_id

Study identifier (1-150)

drug_regimen

Drug options: Drug A/B/C or Standard Care

dosing_strategy

Dosing approach: Standard/High/Personalized Dose

administration

Route: Oral/IV/Subcutaneous

prob_response

Probability of treatment response (varies by drug)

prob_severe_ae

Probability of severe adverse events

prob_discontinuation

Probability of treatment discontinuation

cost_drug_per_cycle

Cost per treatment cycle (varies by drug)

cost_administration

Administration cost (varies by route)

cost_monitoring

Monitoring costs (mean: 800)

cost_ae_management

Adverse event management cost (mean: 3,000)

cost_progression

Cost of disease progression (mean: 15,000)

utility_response

Utility value with treatment response (0.75-0.9)

utility_stable

Utility value with stable disease (0.6-0.75)

utility_progression

Utility value with progression (0.3-0.5)

utility_severe_ae

Utility value with severe AEs (0.4-0.6)

progression_free_survival

Progression-free survival in months

overall_survival

Overall survival in months

quality_of_life_score

Quality of life score (0-100)

Source

Simulated pharmaceutical trial data

Examples

data(pharma_decision_data)
head(pharma_decision_data)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 19
#>   study_id drug_regimen  dosing_strategy   administration prob_response
#>      <int> <chr>         <chr>             <chr>                  <dbl>
#> 1        1 Drug B        High Dose         Subcutaneous           0.670
#> 2        2 Drug C        Personalized Dose Oral                   0.830
#> 3        3 Drug A        Standard Dose     Subcutaneous           0.632
#> 4        4 Drug B        High Dose         IV                     0.541
#> 5        5 Drug B        High Dose         Oral                   0.649
#> 6        6 Standard Care High Dose         Subcutaneous           0.426
#> # ℹ 14 more variables: prob_severe_ae <dbl>, prob_discontinuation <dbl>,
#> #   cost_drug_per_cycle <dbl>, cost_administration <dbl>,
#> #   cost_monitoring <dbl>, cost_ae_management <dbl>, cost_progression <dbl>,
#> #   utility_response <dbl>, utility_stable <dbl>, utility_progression <dbl>,
#> #   utility_severe_ae <dbl>, progression_free_survival <dbl>,
#> #   overall_survival <dbl>, quality_of_life_score <dbl>

# Complex drug comparison analysis
# Multiple decision variables and outcome measures
